tools.description: Inspect recent network requests and responses for the browser session. Returns sanitized request/response pairs with sensitive headers redacted by default. Useful for debugging auth flows (e.g. verifying Bearer tokens are being sent). Captures last 50 requests with a 5-minute TTL.

errors.message: Browser session not found
errors.solution: Check browserId or launch a new browser first

errors.message: includeRaw requires BROOKLYN_FULL_HEADER_SUPPORT=true
errors.solution: Set the BROOKLYN_FULL_HEADER_SUPPORT=true environment variable to enable raw header access

examples.description: Inspect all recent requests for auth debugging
Filter requests by URL pattern and method

browserId.description: Optional. ID of the browser instance. If omitted or invalid, the server will resolve based on 'target'.

urlPattern.description: Filter requests by URL substring match (e.g. '/api/')

includeRaw.description: Include unredacted header values. Requires BROOKLYN_FULL_HEADER_SUPPORT=true env var. Limited to 10 requests when enabled. An audit log entry is generated.

redact.description: Header names to redact. Defaults to ['Authorization', 'Cookie', 'Set-Cookie', 'Proxy-Authorization', 'X-API-Key', 'X-Auth-Token'].

target.description: Optional targeting strategy when browserId is omitted or invalid. latest: most recently launched active browser (default). current: your last-used browser. byId: require valid browserId.

tools.description: Capture a screenshot and store as file to avoid MCP token limits (Architecture Committee approved). If browserId is omitted, the most recently launched active browser for your team is used (target=latest).

errors.message: Browser session not found
errors.solution: Check browserId or launch a new browser first

errors.message: Screenshot storage quota exceeded
errors.solution: Clean up old screenshots or increase quota limits

errors.message: Security violation in output path
errors.solution: Use relative paths within allowed directories only

examples.description: Capture full page screenshot with file storage (recommended, no browserId)
Capture with base64 thumbnail for backward compatibility
High quality JPEG for documentation
Organized screenshot with custom tag for multi-instance management

browserId.description: Optional. ID of the browser. If omitted or invalid, the server will resolve based on 'target'.

fullPage.description: Capture full page instead of viewport

outputPath.description: Custom output path (advanced usage, validated for security)

returnFormat.description: How to return the screenshot data (file=path, url=HTTP endpoint, base64_thumbnail=small preview)

selector.description: CSS selector of element to capture (optional)

tag.description: User-provided tag for organizing screenshots (auto-generated if not provided)

target.description: Optional targeting strategy when browserId is omitted or invalid. latest: most recently launched active browser (default). current: your last-used browser. byId: require valid browserId.

teamId.description: Team identifier for directory isolation and quotas

tools.name: take_screenshot

target.description: Optional targeting strategy when browserId is omitted or invalid. latest: most recently launched active browser (default). current: your last-used browser. byId: require valid browserId.
